problem_text:
Let F be a finitely generated non-Abelian free group and let G be the Cartesian (unrestricted) product of countable infinity of copies of F. Must the Abelianization G/G′ of G be torsion-free?
A. M. Gaglione, D. Spellman
answer: No, it may contain elements of order 2 (O. Kharlampovich, A. Myasnikov, in: Knots, braids, and mapping class groups — papers dedicated to Joan S. Birman (New York, 1998), Amer. Math. Soc., Providence, RI, 2001, 77–83).
